Package space.sunqian.common.io.communicate

Class AbstractChannelContext<C extends ByteChannel>

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.common.io.communicate.AbstractChannelContext<C>
Type Parameters:
C - the type of the underlying channel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChannelContext<C>, ChannelReader<C>, ChannelWriter<C>
public abstract class AbstractChannelContext<C extends ByteChannel> extends Object implements ChannelContext<C>
Skeletal implementation of ChannelContext. Its read methods are based on the specified IOOperator provided by ioOperator(). The underlying channel is provided by channel().

    • attach

      public void attach(Object attachment)
      Description copied from interface: ChannelContext
      Attaches the given attachment to this context. The given attachment object is bound to this context for its remaining lifetime. This method can be invoked multiple times to update the attachment.
      Specified by:
      attach in interface ChannelContext<C extends ByteChannel>
      Parameters:
      attachment - the given attachment to be attached

    • availableString

      @Nullable public @Nullable String availableString() throws IORuntimeException
      Description copied from interface: ChannelReader
      Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed. The string is decoded by the CharsKit.defaultCharset().
      Specified by:
      availableString in interface ChannelReader<C extends ByteChannel>
      Returns:
      the available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty, may be null if the channel is closed.
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an error occurs

    • availableString

      @Nullable public @Nullable String availableString(@Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset) throws IORuntimeException
      Description copied from interface: ChannelReader
      Returns all available bytes as a string in the underlying channel, possibly empty if no data is available but the channel is still alive, or null if the channel is closed. The string is decoded by the specified charset.
